channel.title: MY jad attempts [updated]
channel.description:
[s]My friend is pestering me about going for the firecape, except I personally do not think I could do it. My hitpoints are 80, prayer is 55, defence is 78 (like 2k exp to 79, so basically 79), and I have 66 ranged =\. He keeps saying that a 42 did it (yes, I saw the video and saw his 52 ranged), but he did the jad like 50 times before. This would be my first time. I really can't be arsed to raise my ranged to 70, and I do have a bit of money for almost any route to the jad and victory. Any suggestions/ideas?[/s]
Edit: Okay, so after getting my prayer to 60 and unlocking chivalry, I have easily gotten to the jad a second time (also with my inventory item shifts). However, luckily I made it to the jad and switched prayers fast enough (woo-hoo). However, I started nerving up and I kept hitting the wrong protect prayer (jad kept doubling and tripling a single attack in a row), so he did several hard damages on me. Well, this went alright for a while, as I got him down to half health and the healers came out. Well, I misclicked for the fifth or sixth time and the jad hit a final 43 on me, which took me out of play. I just rebought the supplies for another trip, but it is too late to start it. I will train my ranged up for now while I wait for tomorrow. (i also got up to 68 ranged in the caves and hopefully will have 69 or 70 for tomorrow's trip). Thanks and goodnight!
Okay, well, I just did the caves twice tonight. The first time I got almost to the 3/4 marker and I click the mage protect too slow and got hit a 50+ to die. So, I went again with slightly different configuration just now and I made it to jad. However, I walked up to him and click mage protect again a second too late and got hit a max of 80. He took me down at full health =(. I will try again tomorrow by swapping 2 sara brews with super restores and the 4 ppot slots with super restores.
By the way, I have 67 ranged and 79 defense. Don't tell me it isn't possible with >70 because it certainly is.
Here are some pics:
Wave before 7/8 marker: [img]http://img81.imageshack.us/img81/328/kajfelkjalkfjkldfjaeetl3.jpg[/img]
This is three waves before jad (the 360, 180, 90, 90 wave): [img]http://img260.imageshack.us/img260/8905/aejfakefanfckajnfawe2jl7.jpg[/img]
This is two waves before jad (the 360, 180, 180 wave): [img]http://img402.imageshack.us/img402/6383/akfjekjafkehfaewjkfhajkez2.jpg[/img]
This is wave before jad: [img]http://img516.imageshack.us/img516/9894/lkajfekljaklfjalkjdfklain0.jpg[/img]
You can see I run out of super restores. I average one super restore to every 360 and a few extras after the 3/4 marker.

item.title: MY jad attempts [updated]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:29, topic:178952”][quote author=billygotshot link=topic=240053.msg2052422#msg2052422 date=1202978379]

Hmm. What’s that purple item in cowie’s inventory?

purple sweets…
[/quote]And, what do these Purple Sweets do?[/quote]

They are also a treasure trail (lvl 3 only?) item that are moderately rare. They cost 1.5k each. They randomly heal between 1-4 hp (usually leaning toward 1s and 2s) and also restore energy (by like 1-5%). The only reason why they are ‘good’ is because they are stackable. They have saved me several times in the caves so far as well.

Read full topic

item.title: MY jad attempts [updated]
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Awhile back, I could do Jad with 60 ranged, but I had a lot of experience(I’ve completed him at least 10-15 times; for myself, and a few friends). Your best bet would be just to not get nervous. That seems to be the biggest problem, people get nervous and start spam clicking, that’s how they mess up.

item.title: MY jad attempts [updated]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“billygotshot, post:19, topic:178952”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=240053.msg2037981#msg2037981 date=1202437947]

Well you guys are honestly lucky when it comes to fighting jad unless the have not fixed the prayer lag… Which made it alot harder to switch prayers fast enough. I did it 7 times though failed everytime at jad and i died the first 2 because of stupidity and the last 5 because of lag.

I lag periodically and hope and pray (pun not intended) that I don’t ‘just happen’ to lag @ jad. And also, I know what you are talking about with prayer. It isnt lag, it is just a one second delay on prayer activation. It is all part of the jad strategy.
[/quote]

lol well i guess they newly introduced it because of jad… because they said they fixed it and made it worse lol.[/quote]

Actually it is better. Switching prayers no longer counts as an action and therefore you don’t have to reattack the npc or wait a turn for auto-retaliate to kick in. The only downfall is the slightly longer transfer delay.

Read full topic

item.title: MY jad attempts [updated]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

.Kaboom:

Don’t take holy wrench, if you do the math, 1 super restore will heal more points than the bonuses wrench gives.

10 Super restores(4) = 40 doses * (21 + 1) = 880 prayer points
11 Super restores(4) = 44 doses * 21 = 924 prayer points

Thanks for pointing this out to me. I have also decided to swap my snakeskin boots with ranger boots (which means I am getting 70 ranged.) I will also be getting 60 prayer as well, so I should have no trouble making it to the jad and hopefully killing him.

Read full topic

item.title: MY jad attempts [updated]
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Casey., post:9, topic:178952”][quote author=bankotsu11 link=topic=240053.msg2035345#msg2035345 date=1202303723]
i say you got a good chance… i tried with crystal bow on 2nd try and it is rly affective so when jad come out just hide behind italy rock…gl:]
[/quote]
A while ago they removed the rock, or the jads spawning that you couldn’t go behind the rock.[/quote]

Yes, but they were smart enough to keep the jad from being totally aggressive. 1) You can still hide in the corner 2) The jad won’t melee you if you stand a certain number of squares away (just like metal dragons)
